p: The values above 50% for I 2, occurring for the majority of factors for stem failure and the four factors for root failure, depict that more than half of the total heterogeneity originates from between-study variance which cannot be explained by sampling error exclusively. Meanwhile the studies are heterogeneous since the underlying true effect sizes vary (H 0: τ 2 = 0 is rejected in favour of H 1: τ 2 > 0).
